--nys-color-theme.description: Primary brand color. Used for primary actions and interactive elements like buttons, checkboxes, and agency-specific headers and footers. Overridden by agency-specific themes.

--nys-color-theme-strong.description: Stronger shade of theme color, used for hover state on interactive elements. Overridden by agency-specific themes.

--nys-color-theme-stronger.description: Strongest shade of theme color, used for pressed state on interactive elements. Overridden by agency-specific themes.

--nys-color-theme-mid.description: Mid-range shade of theme color. Use sparingly, since text contrast against this color is problematic. Overridden by agency-specific themes.

--nys-color-theme-weak.description: Slightly lighter shade of theme color. Overridden by agency-specific themes.

--nys-color-theme-weaker.description: Lighter shade of theme color, used to subtly convey brand in places with a lot of text, like the global agency footer. Overridden by agency-specific themes.

--nys-color-theme-faint.description: Faint shade of the theme color. Good for subtle accents or backgrounds. Overridden by agency-specific themes.

--nys-color-accent.description: Bold accent color for highlighting or emphasis. Use sparingly, especially in application contexts where it can be confused with warning or error colors.

--nys-color-info-weak.description: Used as a background for informational contexts with a lot of text, like alerts.

--nys-color-success.description: Used to communicate successful actions or states.

--nys-color-success-weak.description: Used as a background for success contexts with a lot of text, like alerts.

--nys-color-warning.description: Used as a warning color for non-critical alerts.

--nys-color-warning-weak.description: Used as a background for warning contexts with a lot of text, like alerts.

--nys-color-danger.description: Used to indicate destructive actions or failures.

--nys-color-danger-weak.description: Used as a background in destructive or error contexts with a lot of text, like alerts.

--nys-color-emergency.description: Emergency color for critical alerts or actions. Use sparingly.

--nys-color-ink.description: Default text color. Provides good legibility.

--nys-color-ink-reverse.description: Reverse text color for dark backgrounds.

--nys-color-link-strong.description: Used for hover and active states on text links.

--nys-color-link-strongest.description: Used for pressed states on text links.

--nys-color-focus.description: Used to color focus rings on interactive elements.

--nys-color-neutral-10.description: Subtle neutral shade for faint accents.

--nys-color-neutral-50.description: Faint neutral shade for background contrast.

--nys-color-neutral-200.description: Very light neutral tone for minimal elements.

--nys-color-neutral-300.description: Light neutral tone for subtle backgrounds.

--nys-color-neutral-400.description: Light-medium neutral tone for soft elements.

--nys-color-neutral-500.description: Medium neutral tone for balanced emphasis.

--nys-color-neutral-600.description: Medium-dark neutral tone for UI elements.

--nys-color-neutral-700.description: Dark neutral tone for text or muted accents.

--nys-color-neutral-800.description: Very dark neutral shade for subdued elements.

--nys-color-neutral-900.description: Darkest neutral shade for text or backgrounds.

--nys-space-1px.description: Spacing tokens standardize margins, padding, and gaps in layouts. This is ultra-thin for fine detail, like borders or dividers.

--nys-space-2px.description: Very small spacing for micro-adjustments or compact layouts.

--nys-space-50.description: Extra-small spacing, typically used for tight content spacing.

--nys-space-100.description: Small spacing, often used for compact layouts or minimal margins.

--nys-space-150.description: Small-medium spacing for general UI elements.

--nys-space-200.description: Medium spacing, commonly used for standard element separation.

--nys-space-250.description: Medium-large spacing for container padding or visual balance.

--nys-space-300.description: Standard spacing for layouts with moderate separation.

--nys-space-400.description: Large spacing for separating sections or creating visual breaks.

--nys-space-500.description: Extra-large spacing for major sections or wide gaps.

--nys-space-600.description: Very large spacing, often used for section padding or layouts.

--nys-space-700.description: Generous spacing for wide content separation.

--nys-space-800.description: Maximum spacing for highly open designs or major layouts.

--nys-space-1200.description: Largest spacing token for creating significant visual separation.

--nys-size-1px.description: Size tokens standardize the width and height of elements, like icons, typography, and UI components.

--nys-size-2px.description: Slightly thicker size for minimal elements, such as borders.

--nys-size-50.description: Extra-small size for compact UI elements or icons.

--nys-size-100.description: Small size for UI elements or containers.

--nys-size-150.description: Small-medium size for buttons or small containers.

--nys-size-200.description: Medium size, often used for inputs or cards.

--nys-size-250.description: Medium-large size for slightly larger UI elements.

--nys-size-300.description: Standard size for larger UI controls or containers.

--nys-size-400.description: Large size for buttons, modals, or prominent elements.

--nys-size-500.description: Very large size for main containers or sections.

--nys-size-600.description: Extra-large size for significant UI containers or elements.

--nys-size-700.description: Massive size for prominent layout features.

--nys-size-800.description: Largest size for visual anchors or major elements.

--nys-size-1200.description: Maximum size for expansive layouts or hero elements.

--nys-radius-sm.description: Small radius for slightly rounded elements.

--nys-radius-md.description: Medium radius input elements like text fields, checkboxes, and select dropdowns.

--nys-radius-lg.description: Larger radius for a more pronounced rounding.

--nys-radius-xl.description: Extra-large radius for buttons, to quickly indicate interactivity.

--nys-radius-round.description: Fully rounded elements. Used for avatars and icons.
